cost_objection.objection: I can't afford tuition on top of everything else
cost_objection.wrong_approach: Our payment plans make it affordable for anyone
cost_objection.authentic_approach: Let's look at actual numbers together - between financial aid, employer reimbursement, and payment plans, most students pay far less than sticker price. More importantly, what's the cost of not having the degree over the next 10 years of your career?
cost_objection.reframe: This isn't an expense - it's the highest-ROI investment you can make in your earning potential
cost_objection.proof_point: Our graduates see average salary increases of [X]% within [TIMEFRAME] of completion

time_objection.objection: I don't have time with work and family obligations
time_objection.wrong_approach: Our classes are easy and don't take much time
time_objection.authentic_approach: You're right that this requires real commitment - typically [X] hours per week. But here's what we've learned from thousands of working adults: you don't find time, you make it by cutting things that matter less. The question is whether your future is worth reorganizing your priorities for [TIMEFRAME].
time_objection.reframe: You'll never be less busy - there will always be something. The question is whether you'll look back in 5 years wishing you'd started today.
time_objection.proof_point: [X]% of our students work full-time and [Y]% have children at home - they make it work because they decide it matters

age_objection.objection: I'm too old to go back to school now
age_objection.authentic_approach: Our average student is [AGE] years old. You're not too old - you're exactly the right age to bring life experience that makes the education more valuable, not less. The degree you earn at [AGE] still serves you for decades of career ahead.
age_objection.reframe: You'll be [AGE + YEARS TO COMPLETE] whether you do this or not - would you rather be that age with a degree or without one?
age_objection.proof_point: Our oldest recent graduate was [AGE] and said it was the best decision they ever made

academic_confidence_objection.objection: What if I can't handle the coursework? It's been years since I was in school
academic_confidence_objection.wrong_approach: The classes are really easy, don't worry
academic_confidence_objection.authentic_approach: Almost everyone feels this way at first - it's completely normal. Here's what's different: you're more disciplined now than you were at 18, you understand why you're here, and we have support systems specifically designed for adults returning to education. You don't have to be the smartest person - you just have to be committed.
academic_confidence_objection.reframe: You've already proven you can do hard things in your career and life - this is just a different kind of challenge
academic_confidence_objection.proof_point: We provide [SPECIFIC SUPPORT SERVICES] and our adult learner retention rate is [X]% because we don't let students struggle alone

relevance_objection.objection: Will employers actually care about a degree from [UNIVERSITY] or online program?
relevance_objection.authentic_approach: Your diploma doesn't say 'online' - it's the same accredited degree as any student earns. What employers care about is accreditation, which we have from [ACCREDITOR], and whether you can do the job. The degree gets you past the initial screening - your experience gets you the interview.
relevance_objection.reframe: Right now you're not even getting considered because you don't check the degree box - this solves that problem
relevance_objection.proof_point: [X]% of our graduates are employed in their field within [TIMEFRAME], and our employer partners include [RECOGNIZABLE COMPANIES]

completion_objection.objection: What if I start and can't finish? I don't want to waste money on partial credits
completion_objection.wrong_approach: You'll definitely finish, don't think negatively
completion_objection.authentic_approach: That's a fair concern - life happens. Here's how we handle it: [STOP-OUT POLICY], and credits remain valid for [TIMEFRAME]. Most students who pause end up returning because they realize how close they were. But we also work hard to prevent that by [SUPPORT MEASURES] when students struggle.
completion_objection.reframe: Not starting guarantees you won't finish - starting gives you a chance, and we have systems to help you succeed
completion_objection.proof_point: Our completion rate for adult learners is [X]% because we design programs around working adults' realities

timing_objection.objection: I should wait until [LIFE EVENT] is over before starting
timing_objection.wrong_approach: No, you need to start right now immediately
timing_objection.authentic_approach: I understand wanting ideal circumstances. Here's what we see: there's never a perfect time. If you wait until everything is calm, you'll be waiting forever. The question is whether starting now, even imperfectly, gets you closer to your goals than waiting for perfect timing that may never come.
timing_objection.reframe: What if [LIFE EVENT] takes longer than expected? Would you rather be working toward your degree during that time or still waiting to start?
timing_objection.proof_point: Our most successful students are often those who started during challenging times - they just decided their future couldn't wait

2. Check your email address. 'partygirl2006@' won't impress anyone. Make a professional one. Takes 5 minutes.
3. Google yourself. That's what we do. Make your social media private or professional. Choose one.

6. Double-check you're sending to the right school. Yes, this happens. We got 47 'Why I love Harvard' essays last year. We're not Harvard.
7. Take a breath. You've got this. Your worth isn't determined by one decision letter. Now hit submit and trust the process. 💪
